basics.name: Tom Dooner
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a software engineer with an odd fascination with government. I work at Brigade and am a longtime volunteer for OpenOakland, working on  OpenDisclosure, a tool for visualizing campaign finance data.

work.summary: Working at a growing company like Brigade has given me a lot of latitude to contribute to many parts of the stack. I've worked primarily on three teams over the course of my two years here.
highlights: Near the beginning of Brigade, I was part of the Ops team which developed and maintained the initial infrastructure Chef cookbooks
As the infrastructure stabilized, I worked with the API team to build various backend features into our REST API
Lately, I have been part of the Web team building user-facing features in our React JS codebase

work.summary: I developed new features for Causes, a Rails app dedicated to giving people an online place to fight for what they believe in. Causes was acquired by Brigade in June 2014.

volunteer.summary: I have been working on the OpenDisclosure team. We're building a website (http://opendisclosure.io) which tracks campaign finance contributions at the local level.
